intro: Glochidion desmocarpum, commonly known as the red-fruited mistletoe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a hemiparasitic shrub that grows on the branches of other trees, drawing water and nutrients from its host. The plant produces small, yellowish-green leaves and is characterized by its distinctive red, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Glochidion desmocarpum is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
